TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit EnvironmentPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission
Public NotInheritable Class EnvironmentPermission Inherits CodeAccessPermission Implements IUnrestrictedPermission
public ref class EnvironmentPermission sealed : System::Security::CodeAccessPermission, System::Security::Permissions::IUnrestrictedPermission
type EnvironmentPermission = class inherit CodeAccessPermission interface IUnrestrictedPermission

summary.span: Controls access to system and user environment variables.

span.span: Controls access to system and user environment variables.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过用分号分隔，每个列表的读取和写入访问权限的命名变量的一个或多个不区分大小写的名称列表指定环境变量名称。Environment variable names are designated by one or more case-insensitive name lists separated by semicolons, with separate lists for read and write access to the named variables. 写入访问权限包括能够创建和删除环境变量以及更改现有的值。Write access includes the ability to create and delete environment variables as well as to change existing values. > [!NOTE] > 在之前的.NET framework 版本[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]，可以使用方法，以防止对系统资源的意外访问受信任的代码。In versions of the .NET Framework before the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], you could use the method to prevent inadvertent access to system resources by trusted code. 现已过时，并对资源的访问现在只能由授予的权限集的程序集来决定。 is now obsolete, and access to resources is now determined solely by the granted permission set for an assembly. 若要限制访问文件，必须运行沙盒中部分受信任的代码，并将它分配给代码可以访问的资源的权限。To limit access to files, you must run partially trusted code in a sandbox and assign it permissions only to resources that the code is allowed to access. 有关在沙盒中运行的应用程序的信息，请参阅[如何： 运行部分受信任的代码在沙盒中](~/docs/framework/misc/how-to-run-partially-trusted-code-in-a-sandbox.md)。For information about running an application in a sandbox, see [How to: Run Partially Trusted Code in a Sandbox](~/docs/framework/misc/how-to-run-partially-trusted-code-in-a-sandbox.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 创建完全受限制 (`None`) 或`Unrestricted`对所有环境变量的访问。Creates either fully restricted (`None`) or `Unrestricted` access to all environment variables.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法以获取当前权限状态。Use this method to get the state of the current permission. 若要获取这两项`Read`和`Write`权限状态，需要两次调用此方法。To get both `Read` and `Write` access states requires two calls to this method. > [!NOTE] > `flag`参数仅限于的值，它表示环境变量访问的单一类型。The `flag` parameter is limited to the values of , which represent single types of environment variable access. 这些值是和。Those values are and . 可接受值`flag`不包括和，这不表示单一类型的环境变量访问。The values acceptable to `flag` do not include and , which do not represent single types of environment variable access. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用方法。The following code example shows the use of the method. 此代码示例是为提供一个更大示例的一部分类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. summary.span: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.

span.span: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.

returns.span: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.

span.span: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.

returns.span: This new permission is if the intersection is empty.

span.span: This new permission is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 两个权限的交集是描述两者共同描述的状态的权限。The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the state they both describe in common. 只有传递两个原始权限的请求将通过该交集。Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection.

param.name: target
param.span: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship.

span.span: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship.

param.span: This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.

span.span: This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.

summary.span: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.

span.span: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.

returns.span: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

span.span: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果当前权限指定为完全包含指定的权限的状态，则当前权限是指定权限的子集。The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a state that is wholly contained by the specified permission. 例如，表示对 C:\example.txt 访问权限的权限是到 c： 表示访问权限的子集\\。For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\. 如果此方法返回`true`，当前权限表示对受保护资源的访问权限不超过指定的权限。If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission.

exception.span: The parameter is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

span.span: The parameter is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

span.span: if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 无限制的权限表示的集合的权限的所有可能的状态。An unrestricted permission represents the union of all possible states of the permission.

summary.span: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

span.span: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对的调用结果是表示所表示的所有状态由当前权限和指定的权限的权限。The result of a call to is a permission that represents all the states represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. 任何请求都会通过任一权限传递其联合。Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.
